alert.note: Alert for King George (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Watch issued January 08 at 3:41PM EST until January 10 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 10 PM EST TUESDAY... ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, up to 103 feet of inundation above ground level expected in low lying areas due to tidal flooding. For the Coastal Flood Watch, up to 104 feet of inundation above ground level possible in low lying areas due to tidal flooding. * WHERE...Shoreline in Charles and King George Counties. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from 11 AM to 10 PM EST Tuesday, especially around the time of high tide. For the Coastal Flood Watch, from Tuesday evening through Wednesday morning, especially around the time of high tide. * IMPACTS...At 5.0 feet, water covers yards and roads in Dahlgren and on Cobb Island. Water covers the approach to Cobb Island bridge and begins limiting the ability to reach the mainland. Also water approaches structures near Cobb Island. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tides up to 3 feet above normal. The first high tide cycle at Indian Head, Goose Bay, and Dahlgren where minor flood impacts are expected is during the Tuesday afternoon high tide cycle. Moderate flooding impacts are possible as the overnight high tide cycle approaches. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Upper Machodoc Creek at Dahlgren MLLW Categories - Minor 3.5 ft, Moderate 5.0 ft, Major 7.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.6 ft, Moderate 3.1 ft, Major 5.1 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 09/01 AM 2.4 0.5 1.3 0.5 None 09/02 PM 3.6 1.7 2.2 2.0 Minor 10/01 AM 5.0 3.1 3.8 2.0 Moderate 10/01 PM 3.6 1.7 2.1 0.5 Minor 11/02 AM 2.5 0.6 1.2 0.5 None &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
